result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shelby S O'Brien

records.addlTxt:
10:32 AM Cases 16CM119, 16CM308, and 17CF54 called together.  Defendant, Shelby S O'Brien, appeared with Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Schmidt: DA will amend the Count 1: take/drive vehicle without consent in 17CF54 to the misdemeanor variation (joyriding), def pleading guilty to Count 1: possession of drug paraphernalia in 16CM308; all counts in 16CM119 will be DRI.  Joint recommendation of probation: conditions of probation: court costs; restitution in the amount of $267.79.  Def states she can make a payment of $40 today.  DA moves to amend the felony charge in 17CF54 down to 943.23(3m); court grants amendment to misdemeanor violation.  PLQ submitted to court by atty Schmidt.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands what def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty to amended count 1 in 17CF54, and count 1 in 16CM308.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Discussion of restitution, parties agree that the remaining amount due is $242.79.  Court finds defendant guilty and orders a JOC.  Other case/counts are DRI.  Cases are in victim's rights compliance.  DA asks Court to accept agreement, with the probation conditions of restitution, maintain gainful employment, AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations.  DA submits a restitution supplement to the court, notes that the balance due is $25 less than stated on said supplement (due to a recent payment made to DA).  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement, asks Court to order def to pay $40 today.  Def does not make statement to the Court.  Court orders: 1 year probation, withheld sentence, probations conditions: maintain gainful employment, maintain absolute sobriety, undergo AODA assessment and follow-through, $443 costs/count, restitution in the amount of $242.79, make restitution payment of $40 today, make payments of $100 per month, if probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt, follow CHIPS order and recommendations.  Previous balances due to Clerk of Courts to be repaid at $20/month until paid off.  Report to probation immediately after providing DNA to sheriff's office.  1 day jail credit.  Appeal rights provided.
DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.
Supplement to Dispositional Order (Restitution)

03:24 PM 16 CM 308, 16 CM 119, and 17 CF 54 called together.  Cases Defendant, Shelby Sue O'Brien, appeared with Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State.  Cases on for Preliminary Hearing in 17 CF 54 and Status Conferences in 16 CM 308 and 16 CM 119.  Mr. Schmidt will waive prelim and proceed to arraignment, he got plea/sentencing date.    Court informs def. of rights to PH; Waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information.  Proceed to arraignment.    Acknowledge receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Court advises of right to jury trial and speedy trial.  Plea/sentencing set for 8/19 at 10:30 a.m.  Bond continues.

01:06 PM 16 CM 308, 16 CM 119, and 17 CF 54.  Defendant, Shelby Sue O'Brien, appeared with Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State.  Case on for request to modify bond.  No objection to notice per Mr. Schieffer.  Mr. Schmidt makes statement to Court.  Unable to post.  Asks Court to modify bond, in custody 20 days, paying fine, and not a flight risk.  Mr. Schieffer does not object to a reduction, but some money should be posted.  Signature bond in place in the amount of $500, maintain absolute sobriety, no use or poss of illegal drugs/substances/paraphernalia, drug testing upon reas susp. or arrest.  Must reside with mother at 25274 Reh Rd., Siren, WI.  Must pay the $25 on her fine to be released.

No contact with Jeremy DeMars.  No use or psosession of illegal drugs, substances or paraphernalia.  Drug testing upon reasonable suspicision or arrest.  Must reside with mother at 25274 Reh Road, Siren, WI 54872.  Maintain absolute sobriety. AMENDED BOND

1:31 p.m.  Cases 17 CF 54, 16 TR 991, 16 TR 990, 16 CM 308 and 16 CM 119 called.  Shelby O'Brien (in custody) in Court with Atty Kevin Schmidt.  DA Joseph Schieffer in Court.  Cases on for Return on Warrant.  DA requests cash bond of $350 and no contact with JD and no use/poss.  Mr. Schmidt asks for prior bond to be reinstated and she be required to stay at Reh Rd address.  Court orders:  Bond reinstated $350 cash, no contact w/JD, no use/poss, Absolute sobriety, must reside at 25274 Reh Rd., Siren.  For FTP must pay $25 before release.  Pay $50/mo until paid off.  Next date is 3/27 at 2 p.m. for initial on other case.
